AxiomaAPI Package¶

AnalysisDefinitionAPI¶

class axiomapy.axiomaapi.AnalysisDefinitionAPI[source]¶

Access api methods of analysis-definitions using the active session

static get_analysis_definitions(filter_results: Optional[str] = None, top: Optional[int] = None, skip: Optional[int] = None, orderby: Optional[str] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method lists all the analysis definitions

Parameters

  • filter_results – user can apply filter to the list

  • top – returns top N number of elements

  • skip – skips first N elements

  • orderby – sorts in particular order

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

A collection of analysis definition summaries

static get_analysis_definition(analysis_def_id: str, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method returns a single analysis definition based on id

Parameters

  • analysis_def_id – analysis definition id

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

The analysis definition

static post_analysis_definition(analysis_def: dict, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method creates new analysis definitions

Parameters

  • analysis_def – model to create a new analysis definition

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message if analysis definition is created. Code 201

static post_share_analysis_definition(analysis_def_id: int, share_def: dict, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method shares a view with a specific team

Parameters

  • analysis_def_id – id of analysis definition to share

  • share_def – request body that includes name, team and overwrite flag

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message once shared. Code 201

This method is used to get the list of portfolios

Parameters

  • filter_results – user can apply filters to the list

  • top – returns top N number of elements

  • skip – skips first N elements

  • orderby – sorts in particular order

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

This method creates a new portfolio

Parameters

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

  • portfolio – the updated portfolio

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

This method deletes an existing portfolio

portfolio_id – The id of the portfolio that you would like to delete

Returns

Success message if the portfolio is deleted. Code 204

static patch_portfolios(portfolios_upsert: Optional[List[dict]] = None, portfolios_remove: Optional[List[dict]] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method is used to update, create, delete positions of a portfolio

Parameters

  • portfolios_upsert – The positions that needs to be added to the portfolio

  • portfolios_remove – The positions that needs to be removed from the portfolio

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message of the portfolio is updated

static get_position_dates(portfolio_id: int, start_date: Optional[str] = None, end_date: Optional[str] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method is used to list dates for which there are positions for the portfolio, latest first

Parameters

  • portfolio_id – Id of the portfolio

  • start_date – beginning date to filter position dates

  • end_date – last date to filter position dates

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

The dates for which the portfolio is available

static get_positions_at_date(portfolio_id: int, as_of_date: str, filter_results: Optional[str] = None, top: Optional[int] = None, skip: Optional[int] = None, orderby: Optional[str] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method is used to list the positions of portfolio on a particular date

Parameters

  • portfolio_id – The id of the portfolio for which composition is requested

  • as_of_date – The date on which portfolio composition is requested

  • filter_results – filters the response to include only the results that meet the criteria

  • top – only includes top N results

  • skip – Skips the first N results

  • orderby – Sorts the results included in the response

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Portfolio composition on the specified date

static delete_positions(portfolio_id: int, as_of_date: str, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method is used to delete the portfolio entry on a particular date

Parameters

  • portfolio_id – The identity of the portfolio

  • as_of_date – The date on which portfolio composition needs to be deleted

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message that the positions for the date are deleted

static post_position(portfolio_id: int, as_of_date: str, position: dict, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

The method is used to create a new position in the portfolio on the given date

Parameters

  • portfolio_id – The id of the portfolio

  • as_of_date – The date for which position needs to be created

  • position – The position of the portfolio that needs to be created

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message if the positions are created. Code 201.

static patch_positions(portfolio_id: int, as_of_date: str, positions_upsert: Optional[List[dict]] = None, positions_remove: Optional[List[dict]] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method is used to patch the existing positions according to the supplied operations

Parameters

  • portfolio_id – the id of the portfolio to update positions in

  • as_of_date – The date of the positions

  • positions_upsert – The positions that needs to be updated or created

  • positions_remove – The positions that needs to be removed

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

If the positions are updated a success message is returned. Code 200

static rollover_request(portfolio_id: int, as_of_date: str, rollover_date: str, attributes: Optional[dict] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method rolls over the positions from the as Of Date to the rollover date provided.

Parameters

  • portfolio_id – The id of the portfolio

  • as_of_date – The date from where the positions are to be copied

  • rollover_date – The date to which the positions are to be copied

  • attributes – The optional attributes to be added to all positions

  • return_response – if set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message if positions are created. Code 201

  • as_of_date – The date for which valuation is requested

  • filter_results – filters the response to include only the results that meet the criteria

  • top – only includes top N results

  • skip – Skips the first N results

  • orderby – Sorts the results included in the response

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

The method lists all the templates available

  • top – returns top N number of elements

  • skip – skips first N elements

  • orderby – sorts in particular order

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

static delete_entity(id_: int, template_name: str, typeName1: str = 'any', typeName2: str = 'any', headers: Optional[dict] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method deletes an entity. This currently does not delete the underliers.

Parameters

  • id – id of the entity

  • template_name – name of template

  • typeName1 – type of template

  • typeName2 – type of template

  • headers – additional headers, if any required by the request

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message if the entity is deleted. Code 204

static patch_entities(template_name: str, entities_upsert: Optional[List[dict]] = None, entities_remove: Optional[List[dict]] = None, typeName1: str = 'any', typeName2: str = 'any', import_settings: Optional[dict] = None, parameters: Optional[dict] = None, headers: Optional[dict] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method upserts or deletes using the template inputs

Parameters

  • template_name – name of template

  • entities_upsert – list of entities to upsert

  • entities_remove – list of entities to be removed

  • typeName1 – type of template

  • typeName2 – type of template

  • import_settings – settings to control the behavior when importing positions

  • parameters – processEachItem: set to true/false to process each item one at a time or in batch

  • headers – additional headers, if any, required for the request

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Success message if the request is processed. Code 200

  • top – returns top N number of elements

  • skip – skips first N elements

  • orderby – sorts in a particular order

  • headers – Optional headers, if any needed (Correlation ID , Accept-Encoding)

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

  • analyses_parameters – the parameters of analysis to run

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Parameters

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

static get_risk_model_logs(request_id: int, headers: Optional[dict] = None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method returns the logs generated by a risk model analysis request. It searches the ServicesCache for RiskModelAnalysisLogs, CovarianceComputationsLogs and InstrumentAnalyticsLogs

Parameters

  • request_id – id of the initial risk model request

  • headers – Optional headers, if any required (Correlation ID , Accept-Encoding)

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Logs for the risk model request

static get_risk_model_results(request_id: int, show_raw_results: bool = False, headers: Optional[dict] = None, stream: bool = False, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

This method fetches the results of the risk model instance task

Parameters

  • request_id – id of the risk model request

  • show_raw_results – If set to true, returns raw results

  • headers – Optional headers if any needed (Correlation ID , Accept-Encoding)

  • stream – If set to True, response will be streamed; else the response will be downloaded.

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

Results of the risk model analysis are returned in json format

static get_risk_model_request_status(request_id: int, headers=None, return_response: bool = False)[source]¶

  • headers – Optional headers, if any required (Correlation ID , Accept-Encoding)

  • return_response – If set to true, the response will be returned

Returns

ComputeOption¶

class axiomapy.axiomaapi.enums.ComputeOption(value)[source]¶

Enum to define computation options for a performance attribution task. Options control whether results will only be computed if missing, recomputed even if already computed, or used as stored, with no computation.

AsStored = 'AsStored'¶
MissingOnly = 'MissingOnly'¶
All = 'All'¶
